docblock.description: Test that adapter generates a valid salt
docblock.long-description:
The portable adapter should generate a 12-character salt string which begins with $P$ followed by 1 byte of iteration count and 8 bytes of salt.

By default, the adapter should use an iteration count of 12, so the salt string should look like $P$F..., so that's what we test for.

docblock.description: Test that the adapter generates a valid hash
docblock.long-description:
The blowfish adapter should generate a 34-character hash which begins with the salt.

This test depends on the salt test, and uses the output of that test. This way, the test focuses on the hash, and won't be affected by the call to Phpass\Hash::genSalt().

docblock.description: Test that the adapter generates the same hash given the same input
docblock.long-description:
The adapter should be consistent with hash generation given the same input parameters, otherwise the adapter won't be able to actually validate a password (making it useless).

This test uses the output of the hash test in order to be consistent and focus on validation.

parse_markers.error: Argument $salt is missing from the Docblock of adapterGeneratesValidHash()
Argument $storedHash is missing from the Docblock of adapterGeneratesSameHashGivenOriginalSaltAndPasswordString()

docblock.description: Test that adapter generates a valid salt
docblock.long-description:
The blowfish adapter should generate a 29-character salt string which begins with $2a$ followed by a two-digit iteration count.

By default, the adapter should use an iteration count of 12, so the salt string should look like $2a$12$..., so that's what we test for.

docblock.description: Test that the adapter generates a valid hash
docblock.long-description:
The blowfish adapter should generate a 60-character hash which begins with the salt.

This test depends on the salt test, and uses the output of that test. This way, the test focuses on the hash, and won't be affected by the call to Phpass\Hash::genSalt().

docblock.long-description:

This test uses the output of the hash test in order to be consistent and focus on validation.

docblock.description: Test that adapter generates a valid salt
docblock.long-description:
The portable adapter should generate a 16-character salt string which begins with $p5v2$ followed by 1 byte of iteration count and 8 bytes of salt.

By default, the adapter should use an iteration count of 12, so the salt string should look like $p5v2$A..., so that's what we test for.

docblock.description: Test that the adapter generates a valid hash
docblock.long-description:
The pbkdf2 adapter should generate a 48-character hash which begins with the salt.

This test depends on the salt test, and uses the output of that test. This way, the test focuses on the hash, and won't be affected by the call to Phpass\Hash::genSalt().

docblock.description: Test that the adapter generates the same hash given the same input
docblock.long-description:
The adapter should be consistent with hash generation given the same input parameters, otherwise the adapter won't be able to actually validate a password (making it useless).

This test uses the output of the hash test in order to be consistent and focus on validation.

parse_markers.error: Argument $salt is missing from the Docblock of adapterGeneratesValidHash()
Argument $storedHash is missing from the Docblock of adapterGeneratesSameHashGivenOriginalSaltAndPasswordString()

docblock.description: Test that adapter generates a valid salt
docblock.long-description:
The extdes adapter should generate a 9-character salt string which begins with and underscore followed by 4 bytes of iteration count and 4 bytes of salt. The iteration count is encoded as the characters /0-9A-Za-z/.

By default, the adapter should use an iteration count of 12, so the salt string should look like _zzz1..., so that's what we test for.

docblock.description: Test that the adapter generates a valid hash
docblock.long-description:
The blowfish adapter should generate a 20-character hash which begins with the salt.

This test depends on the salt test, and uses the output of that test. This way, the test focuses on the hash, and won't be affected by the call to Phpass\Hash::genSalt().

docblock.description: Test that the adapter generates the same hash given the same input
docblock.long-description:

This test uses the output of the hash test in order to be consistent and focus on validation.

docblock.description: PHPass Strength Adapter for the Wolfram|Alpha Algorithm
Calculate the base score based on string length.
Calculate a score for letter tokens.
Calculate a score for number tokens.
Calculate a score for symbol tokens.
Calculate a score for special tokens in the middle of the string.
Calculate a score for repeated characters.
Calculate a score for consectutive tokens of the same class.
Calculate a score for sequential tokens of the same class.
Map of the number of times tokens appear in the password string.
Map of indices pointing to token class in the password string.
Map of the number of times a token class occurs in the password string.
Analyze a password string and store relevant metadata.
Get an array of token indices within the password string for a given class.

docblock.description: Hashing algorithm used by the PBKDF2 implementation.
docblock.long-description: Defaults to sha256.
This implementation passes tests using vectors given in RFC 6070 s.2, PBKDF2 HMAC-SHA1 Test Vectors. Vectors given for PBKDF2 HMAC-SHA2 at http://stackoverflow.com/questions/5130513 also pass.

docblock.description: Binary logarithm value used in password stretching.
docblock.long-description:
This number determines the cost of calculating hash values for the various adapters. This value should be between 4 and 30, representing a total cost of 2^x, or 16 and 1,073,741,824, respectively.

Each adapter may treat this number differently. Generally, a calculated value of 256 means that the password string is iteratively hashed 256 times, which increases the time and CPU cost associated with generating the hash value.

docblock.description: String of ASCII characters used in itoa64 operations.

docblock.long-description: This value is used when better methods of generating random data are unavailable.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Optional; Associative array of adapter options.

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns the encoded data as a string.

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns a string containing the requisite number of random bytes.

docblock.long-description: This class provides static methods for loading and autoloading PHPass library classes. The most common use for this class is to simply call \Phpass\Loader::registerAutoloader() before using any library components.
Performs checks to make sure only local library classes are loaded, and the class file exists within the library path.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The fully qualified class name to load.

docblock.description: Register an autoloader for the library.

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns true on success, false on failure.

parse_markers.error: The type hint of the argument is incorrect for the type definition of the @param tag with argument $adapter in setAdapter()
The type hint of the argument is incorrect for the type definition of the @param tag with argument $options in setOptions()

docblock.long-description:
This class provides a simple API for working with the various hash adapters. When instantiated with no arguments, it creates an instance of \Phpass\Hash\Adapter\Blowfish, configured for 2^12 (or 4,096) iterations. It is also possible to configure the class to use HMAC to provide some extra security where needed.

hashPassword($password);

// Check a password
if ($phpassHash->checkPassword($password, $passwordHash)) {
    // ...
}

docblock.description: Instance of the adapter to use for hashing password strings.
Name of selected HMAC hashing algorithm.
docblock.long-description: See hash_algos() for a list of supported algorithms.

docblock.description: Shared secret for generating the HMAC variant of the password string.

docblock.long-description:
Accepts either an associative array of option key value pairs, or a concrete instance of \Phpass\Hash\Adapter. If neither is given, or if the 'adapter' option key is omitted, an instance of \Phpass\Hash\Adapter\Blowfish is used by default.

 12 // 2^12 = 4096 iterations
));
$phpassHash = new \Phpass\Hash($adapter);

// Customize the adapter as well as use additional HMAC hashing
$options = array (
    'adapter' => new \Phpass\Hash\Adapter\ExtDes,
    'hmacKey' => 'mys3cr3tk3y',
    'hmacAlgo' => 'sha512'
);
$phpassHash = new \Phpass\Hash($options);

tag.name: param
tag.description: Either an associative array of options, or an instance of \Phpass\Hash\Adapter.

docblock.description: Set the adapter to use for hashing password strings.
Retrieve the adapter used for hashing password strings.

docblock.long-description: Available options: - adapter: An instance of Phpass\Hash\Adapter. - hmacKey: A string used as the key in optional HMAC hashing. - hmacAlgo: The name of the hashing algorithm to use for HMAC hashing.

tag.name: return

docblock.description: Create a hash from a given password using the configured adapter.

docblock.description: Derive a hash value from the given password string, optionally using a pre-calculated salt.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The hash string which contains the stored salt value.
